newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: VILNIAUS MOST ACTIVE STOCK LAST WEEK.
newsitem.headline: VILNIAUS MOST ACTIVE STOCK LAST WEEK.

text.p: Lithuania's stock exchange said on Monday that Vilniaus Bank was the most active stock on the central market last week with 317,000 litas worth of its shares changing hands.
Vilniaus was followed by Alytaus Textile with turnover of 251,000 litas and Rokishkis Cheese with turnover of 225,000 litas last week.
The biggest single deal in block trades last week was registered with Klaipedos Nafta shares, which saw shares worth 7.14 million litas change hands.
Hermis Bank's turnover in block trades amounted to 1.05 million litas last week.
The biggest gainer of the week in the A group of shares was Kauno Audiniai, which rose by 17.95 percent to 0.92 litas, followed by Liteksas and Calw with a 10 percent rise to 0.33.
Tractor parts producer Kuro Aparatura rose by 9.63 percent last week to 6.6 litas. Siauliu Bank eased the most last week and went down by 10.34 percent to 78 litas.
